intro: Coussarea chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapan coussarea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
